roleset.name: plan a time
roleset.note: SCHEDULE-V NOTES: Based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus, comparison with 'plan'. Member of Vncls create-26.4-1. (from schedule.01-v)
SCHEDULING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, schedule.01. Corresponds to VNcls create-26.4-1. (from scheduling.01-n)

roles.note: The arg3 "time of event" is entirely separate from the time ofscheduling which will take an argM-TMP. (from schedule.01-v)

role.descr: scheduled to, for or because of; 2nd part of event

example.name: active
example.text: Nissan scheduled a seven-yen interim dividend payment, unchanged.
example.arg: a seven-yen interim dividend payment, unchanged

example.name: passivized and extracted
example.text: ...[the first of five small fields]-1 scheduled *trace*-1 to be brought into production before the end of 1990.
example.arg: to be brought into production before the end of 1990

example.name: passivized, temporal
example.text: [A guild disciplinary hearing]-1 is scheduled *trace*-1 next Monday in New York

example.name: apparent temporal--but not!
example.text: ...[the multilevel railcars]-1, scheduled *trace*-1 for delivery in 1990...

example.name: contrasting temporals
example.text: Today John scheduled a dentist appointment for next week.

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Claimant is not entitled to additional benefits prior to his scheduling for surgery because he failed to persuade me that he was unable to perform the duties of a double-end machine operator prior to July 22, 1997.

example.name: args0, 1, 3
example.text: I had never heard of his scheduling a meeting for later than the dinner hour.
example.arg: for later than the dinner hour
